title: Task: Add Esplora API integration and validation
Task: Create UTXO test fixtures and mock data
description:
## Objective
Create comprehensive test data fixtures for UTXO fetching feature to enable testing without API calls or manual intervention.

## File to Create
`test-data/utxo-fixtures.js`

## Fixtures Required

### 1. Mock API Responses
Create `mockUtxoResponses` object with:
- **singleUtxo**: One UTXO (typical paper wallet)
- **multipleUtxos**: 3 UTXOs (multiple deposits scenario)
- **unconfirmedUtxo**: 1 unconfirmed UTXO
- **noUtxos**: Empty array (address with no funds)
- **manyUtxos**: 15+ UTXOs (stress test)
- **testnetUtxo**: Testnet example

Each response includes:
- address (example)
- data array with {txid, vout, status, value}

### 2. Test Addresses
Real addresses for integration testing (public addresses only):
- Mainnet examples (genesis address, known donation addresses)
- Testnet examples (faucet addresses)
- Links to testnet faucets: https://bitcoinfaucet.uo1.net/, https://testnet.help/en/btcfaucet/testnet

### 3. Error Scenarios
- Invalid address formats
- Empty strings
- Mock API error responses (404, 500, timeout)

### 4. Validation Test Cases
- List of valid addresses (P2PKH, P2SH, Bech32, Testnet)
- List of invalid addresses

## Helper Functions
- `generateMockUtxos(count)` - Generate N mock UTXOs with random values

## Export Format
- ES6 module exports for use in tests
- Browser global fallback (window.mockUtxoResponses) for dev console testing

## Testing Checklist
- [ ] All mock responses have valid structure
- [ ] Mock data includes confirmed and unconfirmed UTXOs
- [ ] Error scenarios cover all failure cases
- [ ] Test addresses are publicly documented
- [ ] File loads without errors in browser

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Comprehensive mock data for all scenarios
- [ ] Real testnet addresses documented with faucet links
- [ ] Can be imported or loaded in browser console
- [ ] Includes at least 6 different test scenarios

title: Task: Add UTXO fetcher UI elements (HTML/CSS)
Task: Add UTXO fetcher event handlers and display logic
description:
## Objective
Add JavaScript event handlers and UI logic to fetch and display UTXOs, integrating with existing ui-manager.js.

## File to Modify
`ui-manager.js`

## Implementation Steps

### 1. Add Global State
Add `currentUtxos = []` to store fetched UTXOs (after line 7)

### 2. Add DOM Element References
Declare and initialize in `initializeUI()`:
- sourceAddressInput
- fetchUtxosBtn
- utxoListDiv
- fetchErrorDiv

### 3. Add Event Listeners
In `setupEventListeners()`:
- Wire up fetchUtxosBtn click handler

### 4. Update Form State Management
In `updateFormState()`:
- Enable/disable fetch button based on online status
- Always enable source address input (for convenience)

### 5. Add Handler Functions

**handleFetchUtxos()**
- Get address from input
- Show loading state (disable button, change text to "Fetching...")
- Call fetchUTXOs(address, testMode)
- Handle empty results
- Call displayUtxoList(utxos) on success
- Show errors via showFetchError()
- Restore button state in finally block

**displayUtxoList(utxos)**
- Calculate total value
- Generate HTML table with headers: Select, TxID, Index, Amount, Status
- For each UTXO: create row with radio button, shortened txid, vout, formatted sats, status
- Add "Use Selected UTXO" button
- Attach click handlers to rows for selection
- Show confirmed vs unconfirmed with different styling

**handleUseSelectedUtxo()**
- Get selected radio button value
- Get UTXO from currentUtxos array
- Auto-fill txidInput, voutInput, amountInput
- Call validateForm()
- Scroll to transaction form (smooth)
- Show success message with formatted amount

**showFetchError(message)** / **hideFetchError()**
- Show/hide fetchErrorDiv with error message

## Testing Checklist
- [ ] Fetch without address shows error
- [ ] Valid address shows loading state then UTXO table
- [ ] UTXO count and total calculated correctly
- [ ] Row click selects radio and highlights row
- [ ] Use Selected without selection shows error
- [ ] Use Selected with selection auto-fills form
- [ ] Auto-scroll to form works smoothly
- [ ] Success message shows then auto-hides
- [ ] Fetch button disabled when offline
- [ ] TxID shortened properly with full value in title attribute

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All event handlers work correctly
- [ ] UTXO table displays and formats properly
- [ ] Row selection UX works intuitively
- [ ] Auto-fill populates correct form fields
- [ ] Loading and error states handled
- [ ] Respects online/offline security model

title: Add Playwright E2E Testing Framework
description:
## User Story

As a **developer**,
I want **Playwright end-to-end testing framework set up**,
So that **I can verify critical user workflows and prevent regressions**.

---

## Story Context

**Existing System Integration:**
- Integrates with: Static web application (HTML/CSS/JS)
- Technology: Vanilla JavaScript, no build framework
- Follows pattern: New testing infrastructure (no existing tests)
- Touch points: Local dev server (http://localhost:8000), offline mode, QR scanner

---

## Acceptance Criteria

### Functional Requirements:
1. Playwright installed and configured for the project
2. Basic test suite covering critical paths:
   - Page loads successfully
   - Offline mode enforcement works
   - Test mode toggle functions
3. Tests run successfully via npm script

### Integration Requirements:
4. Existing application code remains unchanged
5. Tests work with local dev server setup
6. Test configuration supports offline/online testing scenarios

### Quality Requirements:
7. All tests pass on initial run
8. Documentation added for running tests
9. CI-ready configuration (can be extended later)

---

## Technical Notes

- **Integration Approach**: Playwright runs against local server (localhost:8000)
- **Existing Pattern Reference**: No existing test patterns - establishing new standard
- **Key Constraints**: 
  - Must support offline testing (security model)
  - Static files only (no build step required)
  - Browser-based testing (Chrome/Firefox)

---

## Definition of Done

- [ ] Playwright installed (`npm install -D @playwright/test`)
- [ ] `playwright.config.js` created with appropriate settings
- [ ] Basic smoke tests written (3-5 tests minimum)
- [ ] `npm test` script configured and working
- [ ] Tests pass locally
- [ ] README/docs updated with test instructions

---

## Risk and Compatibility

**Primary Risk:** Test framework adds dev dependencies but shouldn't affect production bundle
**Mitigation:** Keep Playwright as devDependency only, no runtime impact
**Rollback:** Remove devDependencies and test files

**Compatibility:**
- âœ… No breaking changes to production code
- âœ… No database changes needed
- âœ… No UI changes
- âœ… Performance impact: None (tests run separately)

---

**Estimated Effort:** Single development session (2-4 hours)
**Type:** Brownfield Addition - Testing Infrastructure

title: Feature: Auto-fetch UTXOs using Blockstream Esplora API
description:
## Overview
Add ability to automatically fetch UTXOs for a Bitcoin address using Blockstream's Esplora API, eliminating manual lookup on mempool.space while maintaining offline-first security model.

## User Story
As a user with a paper wallet, I want to automatically fetch my UTXOs by entering my address, so that I don't have to manually copy transaction IDs and amounts from a block explorer.

## Acceptance Criteria
- User can enter a Bitcoin address and fetch UTXOs
- UTXOs are displayed in a clear, selectable list
- Selected UTXO auto-fills the transaction form
- Manual entry still works (no breaking changes)
- Only works when online (respects security model)
- Supports both mainnet and testnet

## API Reference
- Mainnet: `https://blockstream.info/api/address/{address}/utxo`
- Testnet: `https://blockstream.info/testnet/api/address/{address}/utxo`
- Response: Array of `{txid, vout, value, status}` objects

## Implementation Broken Into Tasks
See dependent task issues for detailed implementation specs.

## Security Requirements
- Validate all API responses
- Never auto-fill private key
- Keep offline-first security model
- Maintain all existing security warnings
